item.title: 前线公司首席执行官认为，即使停火，船只也会避开红海
item.description: 一家大型油轮公司的老板周三说，如果以色列和哈马斯之间的战争达成协议，商船就会重新开始在红海航行，这种想法太 "天真 "了。【原文：It’s “naive” to assume merchant vessels will start sailing through the Red Sea again if there’s an agreement to end the war between Israel and Hamas, the boss of a major oil-tanker company said Wednesday.】

item.title: 范围》称，极右翼可能会阻碍欧盟推动 5000 亿欧元的投资
item.description: 范围评级公司（Scope Ratings）认为，极右翼政党阻碍欧盟填补每年 5000 亿欧元（约合 5380 亿美元）投资缺口的前景使得汇集资本市场变得更加迫切。【原文：The prospect of far-right parties impeding European Union efforts to fill an annual €500 billion ($538 billion) investment gap makes the pooling of capital markets even more imperative, according to Scope Ratings.】

item.title: 美国购房申请五周来首次上升
item.description: 由于抵押贷款利率接近 7%，美国的购房抵押贷款申请在五周以来首次出现增长。【原文：Mortgage applications for home purchases in the US rose for the first time in five weeks as mortgage rates eased closer to 7%.】

item.title: 对冲基金乘势而上，净赚遍地开花
item.description: 今年，在资金经理们加大了对势头强劲的市场的风险敞口之后，对冲基金的各种策略都取得了成效。【原文：A diverse range of hedge fund strategies is paying off this year after money managers ramped up their exposures across momentum-fueled markets.】

item.title: 摩根大通客户在美联储和消费价格指数公布前纷纷买入美股
item.description: 在美国货币政策变幻莫测的一天，股票交易员们担心的是一件事：错过潜在涨势的下一轮。【原文：On an unpredictable day for US monetary policy, stock traders are concerned about one thing: missing out on the next leg of a potential rally.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事美洲
item.description: 早上好。市场准备迎接 CPI 和美联储的双重打击，国际能源署（IEA）认为石油将出现严重过剩，而政治正在颠覆欧洲债券市场的等级制度。以下是交易员们正在谈论的话题。【原文：Good morning. Markets prepare for a CPI-Fed double whammy, IEA sees a major oil surplus and politics is upending Europe’s bond market hierarchy. Here’s what traders are talking about. — David Goodman】

item.title: 沙特可能放宽税收规定以提高债券对外国人的吸引力
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯计划采取一系列措施来促进其债务资本市场的发展，其中包括可能放松税收，希望这将使当地公司债券对外国投资者更具吸引力。【原文：Saudi Arabia laid out a series of steps it plans to take to boost its debt capital market, including a possible easing in taxes it hopes will make local corporate bonds more appealing to foreign investors.】

item.title: 希腊计划提前偿还80亿欧元救助贷款
item.description: 希腊总理基里亚科斯-米佐塔基斯（Kyriakos Mitsotakis）表示，希腊计划提前偿还总额为80亿欧元（86亿美元）的救助贷款，这凸显了希腊在从债务危机中复苏方面取得的进展。【原文：Greece plans to repay bailout loans worth a total of €8 billion ($8.6 billion) ahead of schedule, underscoring the country’s progress in recovering from the debt crisis, Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis said.】

item.title: 诺和诺德威胁乐高作为丹麦第一品牌的地位
item.description: 丹麦的乐高公司（Lego A/S）长期以来一直是丹麦最有价值的品牌，但这家玩具制造商现在面临着被诺和诺德公司（Novo Nordisk A/S）取代的威胁，诺和诺德公司的减肥疗法已成为一种全球流行文化现象。【原文：Denmark’s Lego A/S has long reigned as the country’s most valuable brand, but the toymaker is now under threat of being toppled by Novo Nordisk A/S, whose weight-loss treatments have become a global pop culture phenomenon.】

item.title: 为什么说法国大选是马克龙的一场豪赌？
item.description: 欧洲议会选举通常被视为选民抨击本国领导人的低风险机会，而不是他们真正希望谁掌权的标志。法国总统埃马纽埃尔-马克龙（Emmanuel Macron）以戏剧性的方式对这一理论进行了检验，他的中间派政党在6月9日的欧洲投票中被极右翼敌人玛丽娜-勒庞（Marine Le Pen）的国民联盟（National Rally）击败后，马克龙宣布举行议会大选。这是本世纪以来法国领导人第一次在议会选举前宣布举行大选。【原文：Elections to the European Parliament are often viewed as a low-stakes opportunity for voters to take a poke at their national leaders, rather than an indication of who they actually want in power. French President Emmanuel Macron has put that theory to the test in dramatic fashion, calling a snap parliamentary election after his centrist party was trounced by far-right foe Marine Le Pen’s National Rally in the European vote on June 9. It’s the first time this century that a French leader has bro】

item.title: 七国集团将成立半导体集团以协调供应链
item.description: 七国集团领导人将宣布成立一个小组的计划，该小组将帮助协调对全球经济至关重要的半导体供应链。【原文：Leaders from the Group of Seven are set to announce plans for a group that will help coordinate the supply chain for semiconductors that are critical to the global economy.】

item.title: 欧盟将对从中国进口的电动汽车征收额外关税
item.description: 欧盟将从下月起对从中国发货的电动汽车征收高达 38.1% 的额外关税，这将使全球贸易战升级，并增加从中国比亚迪股份有限公司到特斯拉公司等公司在欧洲销售汽车的成本。【原文：The European Union will slap additional tariffs of as much as 38.1% on electric vehicles shipped from China as of next month, escalating a global trade war and upping the cost of selling cars in Europe for companies ranging from China’s BYD Co. to Tesla Inc.】

item.title: 奥地利将挑选经济部长科切尔填补霍尔茨曼的欧洲央行席位
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，奥地利将在未来几周内任命经济部长马丁-科切尔（Martin Kocher）为下一任央行行长。【原文：Austria is set to name Economy Minister Martin Kocher as its next central bank chief in the coming weeks, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 斥资 6 亿美元的脱衣舞厅大亨的兴衰史
item.description:
Arciterra seemed to offer strong returns in a sleepy niche.随后，这家企业和它的创始人开始陷入困境。

item.title: BBVA 在竞购竞争对手萨瓦德尔（Sabadell）时放慢了部分招聘速度
item.description: 毕尔巴鄂比斯开亚银行（Banco Bilbao Vizcaya Argentaria SA）在对萨瓦德尔银行（Banco Sabadell SA）进行恶意收购的过程中，放慢了在西班牙本土市场的招聘速度。【原文：Banco Bilbao Vizcaya Argentaria SA has slowed down hiring in its home market Spain as it pursues a hostile takeover of Banco Sabadell SA.】

item.title: 白宫推动巴尔的摩航道重新开放的内幕
item.description: 3 月 26 日凌晨 4 点左右，白宫情况室通知办公厅主任杰夫-泽恩茨（Jeff Zients）说，不可思议的事情发生了：一艘集装箱船撞上了弗朗西斯-斯科特-基大桥，将一条公路主干道撞进了海湾，切断了美国最大的航运业务之一巴尔的摩港。【原文：Around 4 a.m. on March 26, the White House Situation Room notified Chief of Staff Jeff Zients that the unthinkable had happened: a container ship struck the Francis Scott Key Bridge, crashing a central highway artery into the bay and cutting off the Port of Baltimore, one of the largest shipping operations in the US.】

item.title: 科威特国家通讯社报道：科威特大楼火灾造成至少 35 人死亡
item.description: 阿拉伯联合酋长国迪拜（美联社）— 周三早些时候，科威特一栋工人宿舍楼发生火灾，造成至少 41 人死亡。【原文：DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — At least 41 people died when a fire swept through a building that housed workers in Kuwait early Wednesday, and officials said the blaze appeared to be linked to code violations.】

item.title: 耐克 "鞋类 "商标在欧盟法院看来太过分了
item.description: 耐克公司在与德国运动装备竞争对手彪马公司（Puma SE）关于使用大写字母 "footware "一词的争议中，失去了 "footware "在欧盟的商标权。【原文：Nike Inc. lost the European Union trademark rights to “footware” in a dispute over the use of a capitalized version of the word that pitched it against German sports gear rival Puma SE.】

item.title: 英国限制乌拉圭史上首位亿万富翁拥有的金融科技公司发展
item.description: 英国监管机构对乌拉圭有史以来第一位亿万富翁拥有的一家金融技术公司实施了一系列限制措施，这是对每天处理价值数亿美元交易的支付公司日益扩大的打击的一部分。【原文：UK regulators imposed a series of restrictions on a financial-technology company owned by Uruguay’s first-ever billionaires as part of a widening crackdown on payments firms that process hundreds of millions of dollars worth of transactions every day.】

item.title: 新加坡与马来西亚接近就经济特区达成最终协议
item.description: 新加坡和马来西亚即将敲定开发经济特区的计划，以促进贸易和互联互通。【原文：Singapore and Malaysia are close to finalizing plans to develop a special economic zone that seeks to boost trade and connectivity.】

item.title: 导致塞甘提巨型对冲基金倒闭的微小交易
item.description: 只用了价值 114 万美元的适时交易，就击垮了亚洲顶级对冲基金之一。【原文：It took just $1.14 million worth of well-timed trades to knock down one of Asia’s top hedge funds.】

item.title: 门罗称中东私人信贷 "大幅 "增长
item.description: 私人信用贷款公司门罗资本有限责任公司（Monroe Capital LLC）在阿布扎比设立了新办事处，希望与中东地区的投资者建立长期合作关系。【原文：Private credit lender Monroe Capital LLC is looking to forge long-term partnerships with investors in the Middle East with its new office in Abu Dhabi.】

item.title: 德意志银行新聘 10 名员工，瞄准中东财富市场
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）的财富管理部门正加大在中东地区的招聘力度，该地区已成为吸引全球超级富豪的地方。【原文：Deutsche Bank AG’s wealth management arm is stepping up its recruitment efforts in the Middle East, a region that has become a magnet for the world’s ultra-rich.】

item.title: Uniper 与俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司断绝关系后欧洲天然气价格上涨
item.description: 在德国 Uniper SE 公司因俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司（Gazprom PJSC）未供应的天然气量而被判赔偿超过 130 亿欧元（140 亿美元）之后，欧洲天然气价格跳涨，这增加了来自俄罗斯的剩余燃料流的不确定性。【原文：European natural gas prices jumped after Germany’s Uniper SE was awarded over €13 billion ($14 billion) in damages for unsupplied volumes from Gazprom PJSC, adding uncertainty over remaining fuel flows from Russia.】

item.title: 国际能源署称中国对美国燃料的狂热是最大的石油需求驱动力
item.description: 国际能源机构称，中国从美国购买一种相对小众的燃料，是近年来全球石油需求增长的最大贡献者。【原文：Chinese purchases of a relatively niche type of fuel from the US have been the single biggest contributor to global oil demand growth in recent years, the International Energy Agency said.】

item.title: 国际能源署认为北极项目将使俄罗斯 2030 年石油产量保持稳定
item.description: 据国际能源机构称，尽管受到国际制裁，俄罗斯的石油产量在未来五年仍将保持稳定，因为国营的俄罗斯石油公司（Rosneft PJSC）开始在一个新的大型北极项目中生产石油。【原文：Russia’s oil output will remain stable in the next five years despite international sanctions as state-run Rosneft PJSC starts producing at a major new Arctic project, according to the International Energy Agency.】

item.title: 国际能源署称：随着需求达到顶峰，本十年石油将出现严重过剩
item.description: 国际能源机构称，随着人们不再使用化石燃料，全球石油市场在本十年内将面临 "严重 "过剩，因为在供应量大幅增长的情况下，需求将达到一个高点。【原文：Global oil markets face a “major” surplus this decade as the shift away from fossil fuels causes demand to hit a plateau amid plentiful supply growth, the International Energy Agency said.】

item.title: Segantii 香港内幕交易案的关键人物
item.description: Segantii 资本管理公司内幕交易案已被移送至香港更高一级法院，为香港针对大型对冲基金的最高级别法律诉讼之一埋下伏笔。【原文：The Segantii Capital Management insider-dealing case has been moved to a higher court in Hong Kong, setting the scene for one of the highest-profile legal actions against a major hedge fund in the city.】

item.title: 莫迪的主要盟友关联股票成为印度股市的意外赢家
item.description: 本月，在印度南部安得拉邦的一位政治家支持总理纳伦德拉-莫迪组建政府后，该地区的一些公司出现了大幅反弹。【原文：A bunch of companies based in India’s southern state of Andhra Pradesh have rallied hard this month after a politician from the region backed Prime Minister Narendra Modi to form a government.】
